verbs.description: misally (third-person singular simple present misallies, present participle misallying, simple past and past participle misallied)

entries.meaning: (rare) To wrongly join together; to wrongly ally with or to.
examples: The sooner they part company the better.

entries.meaning: (now dated or historical) To marry badly; to marry an inferior
examples: Despotism, ... misled him to place nearly all his family on thrones, ... and misally himself with a foreign princess, whose family and country were his unappeasable enemies.
